result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Taylor Lynn Esser was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. Fine reduced by $300 cost of assessment. $392  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

With huber.

records.addlTxt:
*TAKEN INTO CUSTODY*
Defendant in court with Attorney Antonette Hue Laitsch.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM ct 2. 6 mo DCJ cs to 21CM1052, $600, cc, assessment, 36 mo rev/IID. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2  . 

  Victim rights compliance.

COUNT # 1    
-The Court sentences the Defendant to a jail sentence of: 
-Serve 6 months in the Dane County Jail, with Huber privileges; f/w

-Days credit for time served:  0
-Days credit to jail: 0

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
$600 Fine + cc. Fine reduced by $300 cost of assessment 
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. Fine + V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Revocation of drivers license for  36  months, f/w 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for  36  months
-AODA assessment

-DNA on file

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Copy of mintues sent to DCJ via bailiff. 

Becky K

CORRECTION 6/15/22 AT 9:58 AM
Sentence is not f/w, but cs to Sauk Co case 20CT200

Becky K

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Antonette Hue Laitsch.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol in their system. 
Trial Judge - Br 11
